Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PSTO2 18K (Phylloseptin-TO2 analog, synthetic AMPs, XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, amphibian peptide analog, animal-derived, natural derivativeamino acid substitution, amphibian peptide analog, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (94.74%) toPSTO2 7KL=A: 21%, S=K: 16%; I: 11%.Activity: active against Gram+ S. aureus ATCC 6538 or MRSA NCTC 12493 (MIC 2-4 uM), Gram- E. coli ATCC 8739 (MIC 4 uM), A. baumannii BAA 747 (MIC 32 uM),  K. pneumonia ATCC 43816 (MIC 16 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 9027 (MIC 32 uM), and fungi C. albicans (MIC 32 uM). Rapid killing at 2xMIC. It binds to LPS.  inhibit biofilms:bacteria (S. aureus and E. coli); eradicate preformed biofilms:S. aureus. eradicate preformed biofilms:E. coli.Structure: random coils in 10 mM NH4Ac and helical in 50% TFE.In vitro toxicity: horse RBC: HC50 64 uM.
Literature Information.Author: Yin W, Yao J, Leng X, Ma C, Chen X, Jiang Y, Wang T, Chen T, Shaw C, Zhou M, et al. 2024
Literature Information.Title: Enhancement of Antimicrobial Function by L/D-Lysine Substitution on a Novel Broad-Spectrum Antimicrobial Peptide, Phylloseptin-TO2: A Structure-Related Activity Research Study
